name: Alakazam
flavorText: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5000.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokemon to another as long as you don't Knock Out that Pokemon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Articuno
flavorText: A legendary bird Pokemon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Charizard
flavorText: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to unintentionally cause forest fires.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard or this attack does nothing.

name: Dark Blastoise
flavorText: An aggressive Pokemon that tackles anything it sees.
Attack1Text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Dark Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.
Attack2Text: Dark Blastoise does 10 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Dark Blastoise during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

name: Dark Dragonite
flavorText: Sometimes called "The God of Destruction." Its wings are able to support it in spite of its massive weight.
Ability1Text: When you play Dark Dragonite from your hand, search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokemon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Dark Persian
flavorText: Popular with women because of its beautiful fur. The leader of the Rockets keeps one as a pet.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon and switch it with the Defending Pokemon. This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Dark Raichu
flavorText: Stores up electricity in its body, then suddenly releases it to surprise and shock everyone.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, flip another coin. If the second coins is heads, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. If the second coin is tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Dark Slowbro
flavorText: It loves nothing better than to be left alone, and so sometimes ends up being manipulated by unscrupulous people.
Ability1Text: When you play Dark Slowbro from your hand, choose up to 3 Basic Pokemon and/or Evolution cards from your discard pile and put them into your hand.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Dark Vaporeon
flavorText: A Pokemon capable of controlling water, so it is capable of creating giant whirlpools.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

name: Flareon
flavorText: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.
Attack2Text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Flareon or this attack does nothing.

name: Gengar
flavorText: Under a full moon, this Pokemon like to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokemon to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokemon). This power can't be used if Gengar is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Gyarados
flavorText: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Hitmonlee
flavorText: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon, and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Jolteon
flavorText: It accumulates negative ions from the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.
Attack2Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Machamp
flavorText: Using its amazing muscles, it throws powerful punches that can knock its victim clear over the horizon.
Ability1Text: Whenever your opponent's attack damages Machamp (even if Machamp is Knocked Out), this power does 10 damage to the attacking Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power can't be used if Machamp is already affected by a Special Condition when your opponent attacks.

name: Muk
flavorText: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.
Ability1Text: Ignore all Pokemon Powers other than Toxic Gases. This power stops working while Muk is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Ninetales
flavorText: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Ninetales or this attack does nothing.

name: Venusaur
flavorText: This plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokemon and attach it to a different one. This power can't be used if Venusaur is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Zapdos
flavorText: A legendary bird Pokemon said to appear from clouds while wielding enormous lightning bolts.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Zapdos or this attack does nothing.

name: Beedrill
flavorText: Flies at high speed and attacks using the large, venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Butterfree
flavorText: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal of half the damage done to the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Butterfree has fewer damage counters that that, remove all of them.

name: Electrode
flavorText: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon isn't Colorless, this attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokemon of the same type as the Defending Pokemon (including your own). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Exeggutor
flavorText: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.
Attack1Text: Switch Exeggutor with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Golem
flavorText: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage to each Pokemon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Golem does 100 damage to itself.

name: Hypno
flavorText: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.
Attack1Text: Look at up to 3 cards from the top of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Jynx
flavorText: Merely by meditating, the Pokemon launches a powerful psychic energy attack.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokemon.

name: Kabutops
flavorText: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.
Attack2Text: Remove a number of damage counters from Kabutops equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Kabutops has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

name: Magneton
flavorText: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
Attack1Text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage to each Pokemon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Magneton does 100 damage to itself.

name: Mewtwo
flavorText: A scientist created this Pokemon after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA engineering experiments.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon and attach it to another of your opponent's Pokemon of your choice.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

name: Moltres
flavorText: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.
Attack1Text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Nidoking
flavorText: Uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break its prey's bones.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage and Nidoking does 10 damage to itself.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

name: Nidoqueen
flavorText: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Nidoking you have in play.

name: Pidgeot
flavorText: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.
Attack2Text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokemon, return the Defending Pokemon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

name: Pidgeotto
flavorText: Very protective of its sprawling territory, this Pokemon will fiercely peck at any intruder.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: If Pidgeotto was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Pidgeotto to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Rhydon
flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3600 degrees.
Attack2Text: Rhydon does 20 damage to itself. Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokemon. Switch the Pokemon even if Rhydon is Knocked Out.)

name: Arcanine
flavorText: A Pokemon that has been long admired for its beauty. It runs gracefully, as if on wings.
Attack1Text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Arcanine or this attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Arcanine does 30 damage to itself.

name: Charmeleon
flavorText: When it swings its burning tail, it raises the temperature to unbearably high levels.
Attack2Text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon or this attack does nothing.

name: Dark Dragonair
flavorText: As is fitting for a legendary Pokemon, it has many strange powers, including the ability to make rain or snow fall.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for an Evolution card. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Dark Dragonair is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

name: Dark Wartortle
flavorText: A Pokemon with a negative attitude, it hides in its shell whenever it's in a bad mood—which is often.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: If an attack does damage to Dark Wartortle during your opponent's next turn (even if Dark Wartortle is Knocked Out), Dark Wartortle does an equal amount of damage to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Dewgong
flavorText: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Dodrio
flavorText: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.
Ability1Text: As long as Dodrio is Benched, pay Colorless less to retreat your Active Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Dodrio.

name: Fearow
flavorText: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Fearow.

name: Golduck
flavorText: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

name: Graveler
flavorText: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Graveler (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

name: Growlithe
flavorText: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

name: Haunter
flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.
Ability1Text: Whenever an attack does anything to Haunter, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Haunter. This power stops working while Haunter is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Ivysaur
flavorText: When the bulb on its back grows large, the Pokemon seems to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Kabuto
flavorText: A Pokemon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.
Ability1Text: Whenever an attack (even your own) does damage to Kabuto (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does only half the damage to Kabuto (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Kabuto is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Kadabra
flavorText: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches even to those just nearby.
Attack1Text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Kadabra or this attack does nothing. Remove all damage counters from Kadabra.

name: Kakuna
flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokemon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Machoke
flavorText: Its muscular body is so powerful that it must wear a power-save belt to help regulate its motions.
Attack1Text: Does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.
Attack2Text: Machoke does 20 damage to itself.

name: Magikarp
flavorText: In the distant past, it was stronger than its horribly weak descendants that exist today.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

name: Meowth
flavorText: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

name: Metapod
flavorText: It is vulnerable to attack because its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Metapod during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Nidorina
flavorText: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Nidorino
flavorText: An aggressive Pokemon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Omanyte
flavorText: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.
Ability1Text: Your opponent plays with his or her hand face up. This power stops working while Omanyte is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omanyte but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

name: Omastar
flavorText: A prehistoric Pokemon that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible for it to catch prey.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omastar but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Primeape
flavorText: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until its quarry is caught.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Primeape is now Confused (after doing damage).

name: Rapidash
flavorText: Very competitive, this Pokemon will chase anything that moves fast in the hope of racing it.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Rapidash.

name: Raticate
flavorText: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It seems to slow down if they are cut off.
Attack2Text: Does damage to the Defending Pokemon equal to half the Defending Pokemon's remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

name: Sandslash
flavorText: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Seadra
flavorText: Capable of swimming backward by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Seadra but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Seadra.

name: Snorlax
flavorText: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.
Ability1Text: Snorlax can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, Poisoned, or Burned. This power stops working while Snorlax is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Tauros
flavorText: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Tauros. Flip a coin. If tails, Tauros is now Confused (after doing damage).

name: Tentacruel
flavorText: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, the are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Abra
flavorText: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and teleport to safety.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Bulbasaur
flavorText: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. Thus, a plant sprouted and now grows with this Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Bulbasaur.

name: Caterpie
flavorText: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Charmander
flavorText: Obviously prefers hot places. If it gets caught in the rain, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
Attack2Text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmander or this attack does nothing.

name: Doduo
flavorText: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Dratini
flavorText: Long considered a mythical Pokemon until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

name: Drowzee
flavorText: Not popular with girls because of its attitude. Can often be heard muttering to itself in a low voice.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep; if tails, your Active Pokemon is now Asleep. The power can't be used if Drowzee is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Eevee
evolvesTo: Vaporeon, Jolteon, Flareon, Sylveon, Espeon, Umbreon, Leafeon, Glaceon
flavorText: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from elemental stones.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can't attack Eevee during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokemon ends this effect.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

name: Exeggcute
flavorText: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Exeggcute.

name: Gastly
flavorText: A mysterious Pokemon. Some say it is a lifeform from another dimension, while others believe it is formed from smog.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Put up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. Gastly does 10 damage to itself.

name: Geodude
flavorText: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Grimer
flavorText: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: All damage done by attacks to Grimer during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Machop
flavorText: It's said that not even pro wrestlers can take down a Machop.

name: Magnemite
flavorText: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses attacks like Thunder Wave.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each Pokemon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Magnemite does 40 damage to itself.

name: Mankey
flavorText: Normally friendly, it quickly becomes angry if it doesn't get what it wants.
Attack1Text: Shuffle your opponent's deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

name: Nidoran ♀
flavorText: Although small, its venomous barbs make this Pokemon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokemon named Nidoran ♀ or Nidoran ♂ and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

name: Nidoran ♂
flavorText: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger, more powerful of its horns secretes venom.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Onix
flavorText: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, though colored black.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Onix (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

name: Pidgey
flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokemon.)

name: Pikachu
flavorText: When several of these Pokemon gather, their electricity can build and cause lightning storms.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Ponyta
flavorText: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything flat in moments.

name: Psyduck
flavorText: It is often seen holding its head in its paws, as if it were suffering from a headache.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Psyduck but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

name: Rattata
flavorText: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

name: Rhyhorn
flavorText: Its massive bones are 1,000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can't attack during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokemon ends this effect.)

name: Sandshrew
flavorText: Burrow deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Seel
flavorText: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. This horn is used for bashing through thick ice.

name: Slowpoke
flavorText: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove a damage counter from Slowpoke. This attack can't be used if Slowpoke has no damage counters on it.
Attack2Text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Slowpoke in order to use this attack. Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Spearow
flavorText: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.
Attack2Text: If Spearow was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Spearow to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Squirtle
flavorText: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Squirtle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

name: Tentacool
flavorText: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.
Ability1Text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may return Tentacool to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to Tentacool.) This power can't be used the turn you put Tentacool into play or if Tentacool is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Voltorb
flavorText: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poke Ball, it has zapped many people.

name: Vulpix
flavorText: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. Its tail splits from the tip as it grows older.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Weedle
flavorText: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp, venomous stinger on its head.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.
